item.title: Beyond the AI Bubble
item.description: I think the question of whether artificial intelligence constitutes a bubble is poorly posed. The bubble metaphor comes from financial history, where asset prices detach from intrinsic value and collapse once expectations revert. That metaphor presumes a static underlying substrate, an asset with relatively fixed fundamentals. In the case of AI, the substrate itself is mutating at a pace too rapid for conventional analogies to capture.
